citation: Proclamation under the Criminal Investigation (Extra-Territorial Offences) Act 1987 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Criminal Investigation (Extra-Territorial Offences) Act 1987

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 3(3) of the Criminal Investigation (Extra-Territorial Offences) Act 1987 â€“

        (a) revoke the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1989, No. 67; and
        (b) declare each of the laws specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be a corresponding law for the purposes of that Act; and
        (c) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
25 January 2010

PETER G. UNDERWOOD

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

LARA GIDDINGS

Minister for Justice

SCHEDULE 1 - Corresponding laws

  1. Part 5 of the Law Enforcement (Powers and Responsibilities) Act 2002 of New South Wales  2. Part IIA of the Crimes Act 1958 of Victoria  3. Part 1 of Chapter 7, and Division 8 of Part 3 of Chapter 21, of the Police Powers and Responsibilities Act 2000 of Queensland  4. Criminal Investigation (Extraterritorial Offences) Act 1984 of South Australia  5. Criminal Investigation (Extra-territorial Offences) Act 1987 of Western Australia  6. Criminal Investigation (Extra-territorial Offences) Act of the Northern Territory  7. Part 11 of the Crimes Act 1900 of the Australian Capital Territory
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 3 February 2010

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Justice.
